column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/aca47d2a24e39e6a05d85055ce3c6cbcabd8d50b for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
Diff looks good to me, and as this should increase the robustness of leveldb against corruption in crashes, it is very welcome.\n

`just ignore the entire logical record`

Have you looked into what exactly this means to Bitcoin?  Will it rollback and re-index that particular record or silently skip it and lead to a later consensus failure?

This is not about the table files but the log files. The log files just contain a log of modifications (updates and deletes) to be performed on the database. Not being able to read the last one is perfectly fine: it's just as if we crashed a bit earlier (before we started writing a batch of changes).\n
Sounds good.  We should merge this so it gets more testing ASAP.\n

Ok, some minimal testing indicates that currently this type of error is already being ignored in our setup as we don't set options.paranoid_checks. That's surprising to me, as these are errors that (beside the case modified now in 1.17) usually indicates actual database corruption.\n\nOnce this is merged I think we should experiment with setting paranoid_checks to true, so corruptions other than s
